node.title: Pitch invader denies Welsh shot at win over world champions
node.description: A pitch invader has cost Wales a chance at beating South Africa in Cardiff.

node.title: Two five-wicket hauls for Kerr in Wellington wins
node.description: White Ferns all-rounder Melie Kerr has backed up yesterday's five-wicket bag for Wellington with a second today as the Blaze recorded back-to-back one-day wins over Canterbury in Rangiora.

node.title: Ko lights up in third round blitz, Alker one shot off lead
node.description: Lydia Ko has stormed into a four-shot lead after a firing a course record in the third round of the Ladies European Tour event in Saudi Arabia.

node.title: Wary of Afghan spin threat, New Zealand back their own strengths
node.description: New Zealand are aware of the threat posed by Afghanistan's spin attack, but the Black Caps are confident of sealing a semi-final spot in the Twenty20 World Cup with a win in Abu Dhabi, leg-spinner Ishâ€¦

node.title: Black Caps into semi-finals at T20 World Cup
node.description: New Zealand crushed a billion Indian dreams and breezed into the semi-finals of the Twenty20 World Cup with an eight-wicket victory against Afghanistan.

node.title: Ko wins in Saudi Arabia
node.description: New Zealand golfer Lydia Ko fired a final round of 65 to triumph by five shots at the Saudi Ladies International in Jeddah.

node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: In today's sports news - Venus wins in Paris, Hammers beat Liverpool and Scotland beat Wallabies.

node.title: Verstappen wins in Mexico to extend F1 championship lead
node.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen celebrated a dominant win in the Mexico City Grand Prix to surge 19 points clear of Lewis Hamilton in the Formula One championship with four races remaining.

node.title: Black Ferns still have a lot of homework to do
node.description: They may have hammered the Black Ferns again, but England aren't prepared to take the favourites tag for next year's Rugby World Cup.

node.title: Great day for New Zealand golfers
node.description: It's been a memorable day for New Zealand golfers around the world.

node.title: Scotland's Russell to take Lions lessons into Springbok test
node.description: Scotland first-five Finn Russell believes they can claim their second big scalp in a week when they host South Africa at Murrayfield this weekend.

node.title: England will be formidable opponents for Black Caps
node.description: England will be formidable T20 World Cup opponents even in the absence of injured opener Jason Roy, New Zealand bowler Adam Milne said.

node.title: New Yorkshire cricket chairman apologies to Rafiq, promises change
node.description: New Yorkshire Cricket Club chairman Kamlesh Patel has apologised to former player Azeem Rafiq over the county's handling of his racism allegations.

node.title: Jackie Stewart will pay tribute at Fangio memorial
node.description: Triple world champion Jackie Stewart will pay tribute to Formula One great Manuel Fangio this week when the Argentine's last remains are moved to a new resting place.

node.title: Major Asia-Pacific trade deal ratified
node.description: New Zealand has ratified a major free-trade agreement involving China, Japan, South Korea and 10 other South-East countries.
